I am proud that today, Congress is showing the American people we can work together in a bipartisan way to address the ongoing humanitarian crisis at our southern border. 

 https://susanwbrooks.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/brooks-votes-to-provide-humanitarian-aid-relief-for-the-crisis-at-our … pic.twitter.com/o2UuS8O3tn

Providing urgently needed relief for the thousands upon thousands of migrant families & unaccompanied children at our southern border as well as our federal agents who are working to care for these individuals is something every Republican & Democrat should support.

"More than two dozen GOP lawmakers on Thursday lined up on the House floor to call for a unanimous consent vote on the bipartisan Senate-passed bill to provide emergency humanitarian border aid." ⬇️ https://thehill.com/homenews/house/450670-house-republicans-line-up-on-floor-to-call-for-unanimous-consent-on-senate …

House Democrats: take up the #bipartisan Senate amendment to HR3041. It passed the Senate 84-8 & @POTUS already publicly supported it. There is an ongoing humanitarian crisis at our southern border that MUST be addressed. Let's work together to provide urgently needed relief. pic.twitter.com/AkROroggwt

Learn more about the importance of the Strengthening U.S. Olympics Act >> https://susanwbrooks.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/lawmakers-introduce-legislation-aimed-at-reforming-us-olympic-committee …

Importantly, this panel would evaluate how responsive the nat'l governing bodies of each Olympic sports are to its athletes & whether the US Center for SafeSport has the funding & staff needed to effectively respond to any future reports of harassment & sexual assault.

This bill would:
▪️require Congress to appoint a 16-member commission (at least 8 Olympic or Paralympic athletes) to study how the USOC currently operates & provide Congress a list of recommendations aimed at reforming its governing structure to better protect our top athletes

This Congress, I am proud to continue to work towards protecting our athletes by joining @RepDianaDeGette @RepDLamborn & @RepBenMcAdams to introduce a #bipartisan bill, the Strengthening U.S. Olympics Act >>  https://susanwbrooks.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/lawmakers-introduce-legislation-aimed-at-reforming-us-olympic-committee …

Last year, I led a bill in the House which was later signed into law to reform a broken system that has failed too many victims, the Protecting Young Victims from Sexual Abuse & Safe Sport Authorization Act >> https://susanwbrooks.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/bipartisan-bill-protecting-our-nations-athletes-signed-into-law …
Amateur athletic governing bodies can & should do more to protect the safety & health of all of our nation’s athletes so they can perform their sport without fear of abuse.

2 years later, a bipartisan congressional report found at least 2 senior-level Olympic Committee officials knew about the allegations against former USA Gymnastics team doctor Larry Nassar for more than a year before they were made public.

In 2016, an @IndyStar investigation exposed what is now known as the worst sexual abuse scandal in athletics to date. https://www.indystar.com/story/news/investigations/2016/08/04/usa-gymnastics-sex-abuse-protected-coaches/85829732/ …

As we bring awareness to PTSD during the month of June, make sure you are aware of the resources available for those who may need help & assistance. To learn more about resources available, visit >> https://www.ptsd.va.gov/index.asp

Currently in the United States, there are 8 million people suffering from Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder.  These are men, women & children of all ages throughout our country who have experienced a traumatic, life-altering event.
Learn more about the Locking Up Illegal Robocallers Act >> https://susanwbrooks.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/bipartisan-bill-introduced-to-crack-down-on-robocall-violators …

The Locking Up Illegal Robocallers Act works to diminish the dangerous telemarketing scams #Hoosiers & people across the country face daily by better providing law enforcement the information they need in order to put a stop to fraudulent robocalls.

We must do more to protect consumers by ensuring those who violate the law are prosecuted. The Locking Up Illegal Robocallers Act is a #bipartisan bill we can all support that I introduced today with @RepPeteOlson @RepMcEachin @RepAndyKimNJ @RepBrindisi  & @RepDavidKustoff.

In 2018, more than 47 billion robocalls were made in total in the U.S & they continue to be on the rise. Robocalls are disruptive & often prey on our communities’ most vulnerable populations in hopes to capitalize off of their private & personal information.

Today, @LSCtweets Opioid Task Force released their report offering recommendations on how legal aid providers can better work with medical, judicial, law enforcement & others to combat the #opioidepidemic.

Across the country, Civil Legal Aid providers & @LSCtweets are on the front lines of the #opioidcrisis – helping clients navigate the criminal justice system, child welfare system, family courts, or accessing the benefits they need to get & stay in recovery.

This letter was written in response to recent discussions between the U.S. & the Taliban aiming for a peace agreement, which Afghan women were not represented in any of those discussions.
Today, my colleague @RepLoisFrankel & I sent a #bipartisan letter to Secretary of State Mike Pompeo urging him to ensure that women are included in Afghan peace negotiations.
